p: The progression of COVID-19 has been characterized by the typical developmental stages of the disease [ 10]. The initial stage of infection is usually characterized by fever, although many patients exhibit chills, dry cough, and general fatigue. These symptoms can then advance to labored breathing, with the condition of the patient rapidly deteriorating to respiratory failure in some critical cases [ 1]. However, in the majority of the cases, the prognosis is good, leading to a complete recovery in patients with milder illness.
